condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Access to quality education - More children, especially girls, access and complete quality education in safe and conducive school environment (grades 1 -9);

description.narrative: In 2019, more than 15,963 students (including 7,086 girls) in 10 schools in the provinces of Bié and Moxico benefited from expanded access through improved water and sanitation facilities and knowledge on positive WASH practices. In Huila, literacy and accelerated learning programmes reestablished the right to quality education for 2,752 (1,278 girls) children in primary education and 234 (198 girls and women) adolescents and adults. UNICEF Angola also directly supported more than 4,580 primary school children with education in emergency interventions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/12/2019

title.narrative: #of provinces that rolled-out the implementation plan of the National policy on Inclusive Education
Out-of-school rate for girls and boys of primary and lower secondary school age
Education systems are implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote learning outcomes including early learning

actual.value: 2019:MED continues to work to develop its national assessment system and implement regional assessments. In 2019, Preparations to pilot the SEACMEQ assessment tool in 2020 began, and the Math assessment matrix for grades 3 and 5 was modified and finalized to be piloted in early 2020.

title.narrative: National education system implementing a minimum package of interventions to promote inclusiveness and quality

actual.value: 2019:The MoE continued to implement the National Inclusive Education Strategy approved in 2017, including trainings on the policy and the establishment of Special Education Resource centres in 13 provinces.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Inclusive Ed. - Existence of appropriate law/policy explicitly mentioning the rights of children with disabilities to receive an education - score (1-4), see guidance

actual.value: 2019:The National Policy on Inclusive Education exists, and UNICEF has supported trainings for the implementation of this policy in phase 1 and 2 provinces (13/18 provinces). All 13 provinces have Special Education Resource Centres established as well.
